reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Finnpartnership: India market research and business model development plan

description.narrative: In the beginning of the project the main goal is to find the local cooperation partners start the negotiating process and also learn about local farming and its methods. In addition to this the strategic decision about the piloting area is made. Also the a spects concerning the recruitment of the local key personnel are evaluated.The project is launched in the chosen area by the training of local key personnel. Also the existing mobile technology is customized to meet the local demands. The network is create d in cooperation with the local key personnel.The goal of the project is to establish a subsidiary or joint venture in the chosen state in India. The main role of this subsidiary or joint venture is to locally take care of the purchasing process of agricul tural inputs to collect the farmers orders organize the logistics and to follow the local laws rules and regulations.The estimated turnover for the first financial year will be 5M? and for the fifth financial year 50M?.The subsidiary or joint venture is es timated to employ 2 persons full time and 40 persons part time in its first financial year. In the fifth financial year the numbers are estimated to be 10 persons full time and 500 persons part time employment.The establishment of the subsidiary or joint v enture would take place at the earliest in the summer of 2017.The geographic areas that are researched for the subsidiary or joint venture are the state of Punjab and possibly the state of Haryana. In the making of the final decision also the views and int erests of local governmental authorities will have an influence.The possible shareholders of the joint venture would be Agroy Group Oy local remarkable players in agriculture the key personnel of the joint venture and also representatives of Indian governm ent.The premises would be rented.The ownership would be probably distributed resembling the Agroy Group business model in the USA: Agroy Group 70-80% local farmers 0-20% key personnel 0-10%. And unlike in the USA also Indian government might own 0-10%.If a forementioned actions prove to be successful the working model will then be duplicated unto next chosen areas of action.
